Key Match Events: The Yankees played perhaps the worst fielding inning in World Series history in the fifth of Game 5, allowing five unearned runs to score with two outs.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone is the grandson, son and brother of major leaguers and was one himself. This can’t really be acceptable to him — can it? His modus operandi can’t just be positivity. There has to be a greater accountability to cleaning up the messiness of the fundamentals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers won four World Series games with a.206 average, seven homers and 25 runs. The Yankees won one World Series game with a.212 average, nine homers and 24 runs.
Others: The Yankees have been getting eliminated by non-AL Central teams annually in October because they just do not execute the routine well and when the level of competition goes up, those shortcomings in the A-B-Cs of the game are fully exposed.
